message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a unique item that will benefit your business. I'm willing to offer it to you for $18000. What do you think?
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value and my budget.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand that you're looking for a fair price, but I'm not willing to go as low as $12000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering $16000. I believe this is a reasonable price considering the value the product will bring to your business.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above that price. I'm willing to go up to $14000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. I'm hoping we can meet in the middle somewhere.

I appreciate your flexibility, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $14000. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering $16500. I think this price is a fair compromise considering the value the product will bring to your business.

I appreciate your willingness to make another concession, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $13500. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $13500. I'm willing to make one more attempt to meet you in the middle, so I'm counteroffering $16000 again, but this time I'll throw in a sweetener: I'll include a 5% discount on the price, making it $15200. This is my final offer, and I hope you'll consider it.
Thank you for the discount, Alice, but I'm still not willing to pay $15200. I'm willing to meet you at $12500. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I'm surprised you're still willing to go as low as $12500, Bob. I'm not willing to meet you at that price, but I'll make one last attempt to find a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $12500 and my initial offer of $18000, which is $13250. I'll also throw in a 2-year warranty on the product, which is a $1000 value. This is my final offer, and I hope you'll consider it.

I appreciate the warranty offer, Alice, but I'm still not willing to pay $13250. I'm willing to meet you at $11000, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying the product from John for $10000.
